metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4047 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.28.1, 11.x before 11.10.1, and 12.xbefore 12.3.1 and Certified Asterisk 1.8.15 before 1.8.15-cert6 and 11.6before 11.6-cert3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(connection consumption) via a large number of (1) inactive or (2)incomplete HTTP connections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:11.11.0~dfsg-2ubuntu1').
